byline.contributor: Farah Samti reported from Tunis, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.
byline.original: By FARAH SAMTI and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Bomb explodes near bus carrying members of presidential security guard through Tunis, Tunisia, killing at least 12 people; Pres Beji Caid Essebsi declares state of emergency.
lead_paragraph: President Béji Caïd Essebsi declared a 30-day state of emergency after an explosion in Tunis tore through a bus carrying members of his security guard, killing at least 12 people.

headline.main: Tunisia Declares State of Emergency After Explosion on Bus
headline.print_headline: Tunisia Declares State of Emergency After Explosion on Bus

snippet: President Béji Caïd Essebsi declared a 30-day state of emergency after an explosion in Tunis tore through a bus carrying members of his security guard, killing at least 12 people.
